description: From Middle English prowesse, prouwesse, proues, prouesce, prouesse (“bravery in battle; act of bravery; excellence; nobility of character; intelligence”), from Old French proeche, proesce, proeësche (“goodness; excellence; bravery”), from Old French preu, prou, prouz, proz, pruz (“good; excellent; brave”). Compare English proud.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Skillfulness and manual ability; adroitness or dexterity.
(uncountable) Distinguished bravery or courage, especially in battle; heroism.
An act of adroitness or dexterity.
An act of distinguished bravery or courage; a heroic deed.
